abstract: Democrats seemed generally supportive of the administration’s proposal to ban commercial banks from participating in proprietary trading and other risky investment strategies.
snippet: Democrats seemed generally supportive of the administration’s proposal to ban commercial banks from participating in proprietary trading and other risky investment strategies.
lead_paragraph: Washington lawmakers reacted cautiously to the Obama administration’s proposal on Thursday that would ban commercial banks from participating in proprietary trading and other risky investment strategies. Several senators whose offices were contacted by DealBook said they needed more time to study the plan and were not yet ready to declare their support or opposition.

headline.main: Capitol Hill Reacts Cautiously to Obama Bank Plan
